title.narrative: ADOLESCENTS HEALTH

description.narrative: 4.1. Adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, are engaged in integrated, multisectoral and gender-based initiatives of health services that promote their participation, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, benefit from health services that respond to their needs and promote healthy lifestyles.

related-activity.ref: 0240/A0/05/884 PR 4: CHILD & ADOLES HEALTH WELL BEING

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.1. Adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, are engaged in integrated, multisectoral and gender-based initiatives ofhealth services that promote their participation

description.narrative: Since 2016, UNICEF has promoted acomprehensive model of health carein adolescence based on 4 principles: rights; gender&equity approach; life track approach, meaningful and significant participation of adolescents; and intersectoral and interdisciplinary work. The development of this model allowed to the creation of an institutionalized prevention protocols development and track assistance of unintentional pregnancies policy, to widening of comprehensive advisories coverage in schools, intersectoral approaches to suicide prevention and the presence of intersectoral health, education and protection trained teams. The participation initiatives opened the space to get adolescents actively involved in the processes connected to their health’s status. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/08/2021

title.narrative: Number of provinces with health services that include care mechanisms related to adolescent suicide, implemented from 2017 and assessed in 2019.(40876)

Existence of a validated model of suitable health services (with attention to autonomy, confidentiality, guaranteeing rights and a basic set of provisions for adolescents) with an intersectorial approach, implemented and evaluated in 4 priority provinces.(40874)

Percentage of adolescents with provision of health services under the program in 4 priority provinces.(40875)

title.narrative: Existence and implementation of a proposal for a comprehensive policy for the approach and reduction of adolescent pregnancy, at national level and in 2 priority provinces.(40873)
